A.text: It's harder than it looks. Your weapon shatters in your hand on contact with his form.

B.text: Doh! You fumbled your weapon and must roll on the fumble table. Why now of all times?

C.text: Your weapon bites him hard but you're out of position now. You lose the initiative.

D.text: Your glancing blow hurts him and shakes you both up. You are at –10 next round.

E.text: Your fell weapon hisses in "recognition" as it touches your foe's exposed skin.

A.text: You make a solid hit, but this could take quite a while to add up. He's big!

B.text: Your blow to his side sends actual sparks into the air. It's a very colorful display.

C.text: This won't do. Your weapon just glances off his side, although he is wounded.

D.text: Your glancing blow hurts him and shakes you both up. You are at –10 next round.

E.text: That hit hard but only in a protected area. This kind of thing is never easy. Now you know.

A.text: You hit its side for some damage but you're going to need a lot more force before this is over.

B.text: You miss a golden opportunity, but your sword almost guides itself to the target.

C.text: You hit him on target that time, but at this pace you're going to need a critical hit.

D.text: That was a righteous blow and a solid one. A little to one side and he would be in the afterlife.

E.text: Your mortal blow goes awry. This is not the style of a true slayer. Learn this and live.

A.text: You're beginning to take his measure. Blow to his "forearm" hurts him. It's a start anyway.

B.text: Your strike is epic, but it's an epic creature and it will take more to bring it down.

C.text: This isn't working. You hit him hard but lose your grip from the impact.

D.text: You need "absolution" for this one. You trip him and slam his shin with your weapon.

E.text: It would be but a bruise to his unholy hide but for an enchantment on your weapon.

A.text: Your strong strike to his chest is partially dissipated by unseen protection on his body.

B.text: Nice slash to his thigh but it glances off. You know you don't have unlimited chances?

C.text: You are finding your zone. Your weapon hits a critical area but fails to mortally wound him.

D.text: Sparks fly from your righteous strike to his hide. He feels eternity coming for him.

E.text: Thunder roars as you strike the foe clawing at the very essence of his being tearing it away.

A.text: Strike to his side gets his attention. He leaps back away from you. He's getting angry.

B.text: You're finding your rhythm. Your blade hisses as it bites him. He roars. You are ready.

C.text: Hacking at his neck, you bite his shoulder. He slips the blow before it goes too deep.

D.text: Your entire weight is behind your blow into the hide of his side. You thank your god.

E.text: Your weapon in his abdomen leaves him bleeding like a statue in a fountain. Artistic.

A.text: You damage his leg with that one. The look on his face is priceless. confirmation you did it.

B.text: No one has ever hit him in the back before. He doesn't like it or you. Especially you.

C.text: Holding him with one hand you strike him with the other. He throws you back.

D.text: He has a thick hide so your blow lands lightly. You have initiative for 3 rds. His blood is on you.

E.text: Ow! Head bashed in. His dying carcass falls on you and expires in 2 rounds pinning your foot.

A.text: That was quick. Blow to his neck crushes his jugular vein. Falls and dies in 6 rounds.

B.text: That was cold. Blow to his abdomen destroys organs. Falls down with a crash. Dies in 3 rd.

C.text: You are instant death to him with 2 blows to his heart. He is so dead and you are not.

D.text: Without hesitation you put it between his eyes. He's dead and you even have half a round left.

E.text: Chest strike knocks him down but it will take a lot more "slaying" to dispose of him.

A.text: He damages your leg by intercepting your attacking limb with his own leg. Bad bruise.

B.text: You only bruised his thigh but he almost falls on you. Leap clear and don't do that again.

C.text: He's big but your thigh strike sends him back. Adamantium bites deep the way it likes to.

D.text: He needs to recover his footing after that one. A holy opportunity beckons to you.

E.text: Your weapon almost has a mind of its own as it plunges through his heart. Instant death!

A.text: This time he's bruised and you aren't. You were hoping for more but will take it for now.

B.text: Time for a combination. Wound to his forearms drops his guard for a moment. Time to die!

C.text: The fur is flying and so is his blood from the wound to his arm you gave him.

D.text: He's unbalanced and bleeding from that slash to his leg. Of course, his guard is down.

E.text: Deftly targeting his arm you break it. It's useless and so is he as he stumbles backwards.

A.text: Blow to his tummy staggers the big boy. He drops his guard and you have an opportunity.

B.text: That blow to his back damages his wings if he has any. Otherwise his ribs are splinters.

C.text: Sneaky reverse thrust takes him in the leg. He stumbles out of reach.

D.text: Swinging for his head you knock him out (if with helm) or just behead him (if not).

E.text: A slaying opportunity beckons. Epic strike destroys his heart, etc. Drops and dies at once.

A.text: Oooh. Blow to its leg makes a gaping wound. If it has blood it's all over the place now.

B.text: Face strike hits him and leaves him bleeding. He looked more impressive before this happened.

C.text: Did you hit him in the head too hard? He falls on you, but is knocked unconscious.

D.text: Victorious before god. Your weapon to his chest puts him down for 2 rds and dead in 6.

E.text: That blood comes from an artery in his leg. He writhes on the ground for 12 rounds dying.

A.text: Plunging your weapon through his heart he falls on you quite dead. You are pinned 6 rds and you take 20HP of damage.

B.text: Weapon thru his chest. Watch him drop and die in 3 rds. It takes 12 rds to recover your weapon.

C.text: You have struck him in the head and destroyed his brain, and have half a round left to act.

D.text: He just wouldn't listen. Put your weapon thru his ear. He hears you now and dies in 6 rds.

E.text: That's a genuine slaying weapon you have there. Skull parts fly in the air. He falls dead instantly.

A.text: Through its lungs this time. It's down and dies in 6 rds. Bonus to allies. The bigger they are..

B.text: Use the edge next time. You broke your weapon, but you did wound him.

C.text: Skewer that weak point in his neck armor. Twist it for 2 rds as he tries to breathe. He's dead in 6 rds.

D.text: Risking holy displeasure you deliberately blind him and watch him lurch around helplessly.

E.text: Pieces of cheekbone and skull fill the air. He's dead in 1 round. Try to dislodge your weapon.

A.text: He's struggling for balance after your blow to his shoulder sent him stumbling around.

B.text: Firmly whacked in the head he stumbles back and falls down. He's out for 3 hours.

C.text: Total coordination! You hit his chin with all your weight behind it. He's out of it for 30 days.

D.text: Well, you miss his weapon arm but find his knees. That will be more than adequate.

E.text: Arterial blood from his leg sprays everywhere as he falls to his knees dying in 6 rounds.

A.text: Your blow drives bones into his kidneys and liver. He falls and dies in 6 rds. No wonder.

B.text: His shattered jaw ends up in his brain. Dead before he hits the ground, half a round left to act!

C.text: There's no word for what you have done to his abdomen. He drops and dies in 6 rounds.

D.text: Intercepting his deadly blow you crush the side of his head. He's gone and you have half a round left.

E.text: His head is hanging by a sliver of flesh. His death in 5 rounds is an anticlimax to the drama.

A.text: His abdominal organs crushed like grapes, he bleeds all over you He's dead in 12 rds.

B.text: He just wouldn't listen so you plunged your weapon through his ear. He's dead in 3 rds.

C.text: You are death on swift wings. Fights for 2 rds with severed leg artery. Drops and dies in 6.

D.text: Your holy strike penetrates and breaks his spine paralyzing him. He's helpless.

E.text: Strike to his abdomen pulps his internals. He'll die in 4 rds, but you still have half a round to act.

A.text: He's standing but will die in 7 rds from shock and blood loss. Severed arteries will do this.

B.text: Whoa! Sever his spine paralyzing him from the neck down. Oh, you broke your weapon.

C.text: He falls with a mighty thud and dies. The shock of impact knocks you to your knees.

D.text: You skewer his evil heart. Watching him die even your sword sings in triumph. Inspiring.

E.text: That snapped his head back. It even broke his neck. Drops and dies. Bonus swing for you.

A.text: Grappling & dealing him a mighty blow you lose consciousness. He's not good either.

B.text: Looking thoughtfully into his eye you put your weapon through his eye. He's dead now.

C.text: You blind him with a blow to his eyes. He holds his face in his hands and falls

D.text: Puncturing his lung you knock him out. You take 6 rounds to free your weapon.

E.text: Brutal blow to head drives his eyeballs out of sight in his head. Blind and prone.
